channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipped car tyre on Elmbridge Court roundabout, 15th September
item.description:
Seen as at approx 1315 hours 13/8/25, unknown how long it has been there - next to traffic signal 2 which if you come down Barnwood Link Road , the traffic signal is directly opposite the central crash barrier of that junction, but the traffic signal (and trye ) is on the roundabout itself
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Flytipping (not witnessed and no evidence likely)

item.title: Street light not working, 15th September
item.description:
Street lamp opposite number 6/7 in Normal Terrace GL50 4AR not working. We only have 2 lights in the Terrace
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Saint Pauls Street South, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 15th September
item.description:
I have an ongoing issue where a resident is driving over a raised kerb to gain access to their driveway, their initial VDK application was denied due to trees. I have spoken with the resident and explained the reason for it being rejected and advised that the tree were situated too close but he has continued to drive over the kerb and now the roots are becoming exposed. Please can you review the location below and advise on tree health and if this movement continuing will in the end kill the tree? I fear that on this location we will have no option but to fell the trees, my proposal for installed bollards has been rejected which I do completely understand. Please let me know your thoughts, it is very sad to fell trees for this situation but I hope it is not one we come across again anytime soon
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Driving along road and large branch fell onto car smashing wind screen, 15th September
item.description:
W3W location Bee strapped conquests Opposite Tredington sign. Branch fell from tree into moving car smashing screen. Concerns that tree could be unstable after high winds. Large branches moved from road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
